pullRequest.body:
Makes statements about girth more natural, for example, turns `ENat.toNat G.girth â‰¤ 2 * G.diam + 1` to `G.girth â‰¤ 2 * G.diam + 1`.

---

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981087332/job/27583920641)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981087332/job/27583921382)
Can you write a version of the API for `girth`? Eg `lemma three_le_girth (hG : Â¬ G.IsAcyclic) : 3 â‰¤ G.girth` should be true

Looks good now, thanks!

maintainer merge

```suggestion
noncomputable def girth (G : SimpleGraph Î±) : â„• := G.egirth.toNat
```

Unfortunately, this is resulting in the error:
```
invalid field notation, function 'ENat.toNat' does not have argument with type (ENat ...) that can be used, it must be explicit or implicit with a unique name
```
Oh that's because `Enat.toNat` has a stupid bundling. Mind renaming it to `Enat.toNatHom` and making `ENat.toNat` unbundled? Should be a separate PR.

Gladly! #13936
I'm not sure if the `#align`s of the old lemmas are okay this way or not.
You're missing this lemma for `girth` (it will have exactly one `Â¬ IsAcyclic` assumption)
I've changed the way `girth_anti` is stated because I couldn't think of a way to use `Antitone`. Do you have in mind a different way to do this?
Nono, that's exactly what I was thinking of
Same here

Please keep the two API in the same order
```suggestion
lemma three_le_girth (hG : Â¬ G.IsAcyclic) : 3 â‰¤ G.girth :=
  ENat.toNat_le_toNat three_le_egirth <| egirth_eq_top.not.mpr hG

@[simp] lemma girth_bot : girth (âŠ¥ : SimpleGraph Î±) = 0 := by
  simp [girth]
```

I've had to change the order of some lemmas because of how they depend on each other. So for example, `three_le_girth` ended up being before `girth_eq_zero`, although `three_le_egirth` is after `egirth_eq_top`. Is this okay?
You're missing this one for `girth`

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
@[simp] 
lemma le_egirth {n : â„•âˆž} : n â‰¤ G.egirth â†” âˆ€ a (w : G.Walk a a), w.IsCycle â†’ n â‰¤ w.length := by
```
Not sure I agree with that?
Semantic line break triggered by line length being exceeded.
Did I misunderstand and you are objecting to variable change?
Ah sorry, I hadn't seen the line count

```suggestion
@[simp] 
lemma egirth_eq_top : G.egirth = âŠ¤ â†” G.IsAcyclic := by simp [egirth, IsAcyclic]
```

```suggestion
@[simp] 
lemma egirth_bot : egirth (âŠ¥ : SimpleGraph Î±) = âŠ¤ := by simp
```
Is this really necessary as a simp theorem?
There aren't that many occurrences of `egirth` anyway
Is that an argument for keeping it?
This is out scope here any way.

```suggestion
```
Why was there a change in the proof?
Good point, I will change it back.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): Change `girth` to `egirth` and introduce `Nat`-valued `girth`
